conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graph and time interval to determine if the puppy is safe.
The velocity-time graph shows the velocity of the coach bus as a function of time.
The graph is a straight line with a positive slope, indicating constant speed of 20 m/s.
Driver spots the puppy at t = 0 and bus starts decelerating at t = 0.5 seconds.
Calculate the time interval Δt = 0.5 seconds.
Graph shows velocity decreases linearly from 20 m/s to 0 m/s over Δt = 0.5 seconds.
Slope of the line represents deceleration, calculated as -20 m/s².
Final velocity is 0 m/s at t = 4.5 seconds, with deceleration -20 m/s².
Using formula a = (vf - vi)/(tf - ti), solve for vi = 20 m/s.
Safe distance is the distance bus travels before stopping.
Distance traveled is vi * t = 20 m/s * 0.5 s = 10 m.
Safe distance is 45 m - 10 m = 35 m.
Since safe distance is greater than distance to puppy (45 m - 35 m = 10 m), the puppy is safe.
Final answer: The puppy is safe.
